intro: Ribes tricuspe, commonly known as the three-lobed gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to North America. It belongs to the genus Ribes in the family Grossulariaceae, which includes other species of gooseberries and currants. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are divided into three lobes, and its clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces edible berries that are typically red or orange when mature, and it is often cultivated for both ornamental and culinary purposes. Ribes tricuspe thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is commonly found in woodland habitats.
